perturbation.original_text:
WHEREAS, LeadersOnline desires to advertise its job placement services (the "LeadersOnline Services") on certain of VerticalNet's Online Communities through banner ads, newsletters and employer spotlights, to access VerticalNet's proprietary resume bank and to display and maintain a Link (as defined below) from the LeadersOnline Site (as defined below) to a VerticalNet Site (as defined below) to enable users of the LeadersOnline Site to access and utilize the VerticalNet Online Communities; and

   WHEREAS, VerticalNet desires to permit LeadersOnline to advertise the LeadersOnline Services on certain of VerticalNet's Online Communities through banner ads, newsletters and employer spotlights, to allow LeadersOnline access to VerticalNet's proprietary resume bank and to create a Link from the LeadersOnline Site to a VerticalNet Site to enable users of the LeadersOnline Site to access and utilize the VerticalNet Online Communities.
perturbation.changed_text:
WHEREAS, LeadersOnline desires to advertise its talent acquisition solutions (the "LeadersOnline Services") on certain of VerticalNet's Online Communities through banner ads, newsletters and employer spotlights, to access VerticalNet's proprietary resume bank and to display and maintain a Link (as defined below) from the LeadersOnline Site (as defined below) to a VerticalNet Site (as defined below) to enable users of the LeadersOnline Site to access and utilize the VerticalNet Online Communities; and

   WHEREAS, VerticalNet desires to permit LeadersOnline to market its hiring solutions on certain of VerticalNet's Online Communities through banner ads, newsletters and employer spotlights, to allow LeadersOnline access to VerticalNet's proprietary resume bank and to create a Link from the LeadersOnline Site to a VerticalNet Site to enable users of the LeadersOnline Site to access and utilize the VerticalNet Online Communities.
perturbation.explanation: The terms "job placement services", "talent acquisition solutions", and "hiring solutions" are used interchangeably. While seemingly similar, they can be interpreted differently. Job placement focuses on finding employment for individuals, talent acquisition covers the entire hiring process, and hiring solutions is a broad term including various methods of recruiting personnel. This lack of consistent terminology introduces ambiguity about the specific services LeadersOnline provides.

perturbation.original_text: VerticalNet agrees that during the term of this Agreement, it shall not enter into an agreement with Futurestep, Inc. to provide promotional opportunities to Futurestep throughout all of the VerticalNet Online Communities, nor enter into any agreement with Futurestep, Inc. for the joint marketing of each other's Sites or services.
perturbation.changed_text: VerticalNet agrees that during the term of this Agreement, it will not engage with Futurestep, Inc. to provide any form of advertising to them throughout the VerticalNet Online Communities, nor enter into any agreement with Futurestep, Inc. for collaborative promotion of each other's Sites or services.
perturbation.explanation: The terms "enter into an agreement", "promotional opportunities", "marketing" and "joint marketing" are changed to "engage with", "any form of advertising", "promotion" and "collaborative promotion". While apparently equivalent, these variations could be interpreted distinctly, potentially creating uncertainty concerning the scope of VerticalNet's limitations regarding its relationship with Futurestep, Inc.

perturbation.original_text:
In addition, LeadersOnline shall not now or in the future contest the validity of VerticalNet's ownership of its Intellectual Property; provided, however, that LeadersOnline may contest the validity of VerticalNet's Intellectual Property in any proceeding brought against LeadersOnline alleging infringement or misappropriation of VerticalNet's Intellectual Property.

        12.1.2.  Except for the express rights granted to VerticalNet under this Agreement, VerticalNet acknowledges and agrees that the Intellectual Property of LeadersOnline is and shall remain the sole property of LeadersOnline and nothing in this Agreement shall confer in VerticalNet any right of ownership or license rights in LeadersOnline's Intellectual Property, including all Intellectual Property arising from or created as a result of LeadersOnline's performance of its obligations under this Agreement.  In addition, VerticalNet shall not now or in the future contest the validity of LeadersOnline's ownership of its Intellectual Property; provided, however, that VerticalNet may challenge the legitimacy of LeadersOnline's Intellectual Property in any suit brought against VerticalNet alleging violation or illicit use of LeadersOnline's Intellectual Property.
perturbation.changed_text:
In addition, LeadersOnline shall not now or in the future contest the validity of VerticalNet's ownership of its Intellectual Property; provided, however, that LeadersOnline may challenge VerticalNet's Intellectual Property in any action brought against LeadersOnline alleging unlawful use or duplication of VerticalNet's Intellectual Property.

        12.1.2.  Except for the express rights granted to VerticalNet under this Agreement, VerticalNet acknowledges and agrees that the Intellectual Property of LeadersOnline is and shall remain the sole property of LeadersOnline and nothing in this Agreement shall confer in VerticalNet any right of ownership or license rights in LeadersOnline's Intellectual Property, including all Intellectual Property arising from or created as a result of LeadersOnline's performance of its obligations under this Agreement.  In addition, VerticalNet shall not now or in the future contest the validity of LeadersOnline's ownership of its Intellectual Property; provided, however, that VerticalNet may dispute the authorization of LeadersOnline's Intellectual Property in any lawsuit initiated against VerticalNet claiming encroachment or unauthorized implementation of LeadersOnline's Intellectual Property.
perturbation.explanation: Here, I have used "contest the validity", "challenge", and "dispute the authorization" for what should be the same concept: a legal action against the IP rights. The terms infringement, misappropriation, unlawful use, duplication, violation, illicit use, encroachment and unauthorized implementation are also misaligned, giving rise to confusion on what exactly consititutes IP usage.
